page.title: 09Drainage Museum, Prickwillow
page.content: Near Prickwillow Bridge is the Village's Land Drainage Museum which has recently opened. It houses a Vickers Two Cylinder diesel pump which still works even though it started life in 1924. It pumps 140 tons of water a minute. It can pump water over a height of 14 feet but the maximum needed at Prickwillow is 6 feet. {Alec Gathercole and Pat Cox}work in the Museum, Alec has worked on the Engine for over 57 years. The Museum is run by the Prickwillow Engine Trust and is open from May until September every day. Alec told us that when he balances a coin on the massive engine as it is working, it will not fall down.
